results.title: Common heart disorders and their causes
results.brief_description: The film first reviews the proper functioning of a healthy heart and circulatory system. It then studies common heart disorders giving the history, symptoms and effects of a typical case of childhood rheumatic fever; the assumed causes of hypertension and the effects of each of the conditions which may be caused by arteriosclerosis (hardening of the arteries). Correlated with “Textbook of healthful living” by Dr Harold S. Diehl.

results.title: Commitment
results.creator_credit: David Zweck, Daryl Wayland and Country Education Project
results.brief_description: Jocelyn Terry leads a discussion with Laurie Clancy of La Trobe University and Colin Goodwin of the Phillip Institute, in aspects of commitment as revealed in Thomas Keneally’s book “Schindler’s Ark” and in Graham Greene’s book “The Power and the Glory”. Some provocative considerations emerge about the varieties of commitment, motivations for and consequences of commitment, as revealed in these texts.

results.title: Coming of age
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Romans in Britain”.
The second program in the Roman’s in Britain series which discusses the progression of the Roman rule over Britain over 4 centuries. It focuses on the history of the development of cities in Britain under the Roman Empire and their development of the notion of the country being a unified entity, a province governed from the centre rather than being separately managed tribal lands. This was symbolised most strikingly by the Roman’s establishment of the port town of London as a capital city and the legacy of 400 years worth of road construction across the country for ease of trade and travel between districts. The program also looks at the influence of the Roman empire over food preparation, the establishment of bath houses, architectural traditions, dynamics of the marketplace and the establishment of industrial complexes in early Britain. In the process the merging of the Celtic cultural landscape with that of Rome is examined, with discussion of the acknowledgement of the different cultures within the constructions of the Roman Empire in Britain as each country became a visible part of the other.

results.title: Comets: time capsules of the solar system
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Media Four Productions and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: Animation sequences are combined with live footage to explore the role comets play in contemporary science research about the solar system’s beginnings. Shows how man’s knowledge of comets has evolved from superstitious fear to a growing understanding of their composition and structure.
results.title_for_label: Comets: time capsules of the solar system

results.title: Comedy greats: Peter Cooke & Dudley Moore
results.brief_description: This film is a collection of some of the infectious comic skits conceived and performed by Peter Cook and Dudley Moore that were to influence and inspire a generation of performers with their fresh and innovative style. Collected from their landmark 60’s TV show, “Not only but also”, this video samples some of the best, to include; Bo Dudley, The Leaping Nuns, Roger and Sir discussing ‘the opposite number and how Roger came to be’, the moving life story of acclaimed Finnish film star of the 30’s Bargo (aka Anna Nigma), Pete and Dud discussing how they’ve rejected a host of screen sirens from Betty Grable to Anna Magnani. Including many other skits, they particularly enjoy poking fun at the film industry and the art world in general. Their repartee and affection for each other is obvious, especially when together they employ a number of techniques to prevent themselves from laughing, including stuffing their mouths with food.

results.title: Come September
results.creator_credit: Robert Rothols and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: This film was made during the Centenary Royal Show in 1972, to commemorate 100 years of traditional partnership between the Department of Agriculture and the Royal Agriculture Society in the Royal Show. Using locations sound and music only, the film aims to give an impression of the contrasting facets of the Melbourne Show, and how it sets out to attract a wide range of people, mainly from urban areas.

results.title: Come out fighting
results.brief_description: A young Aboriginal boxer is taken up by University students and finds it hard to adjust entering their bourgeois white world. This short is ragged and rough around the edges but it offers a rivetting glimpse into black and white relations in the early seventies, as well as some wonderful realistic sequences set in inner-city boxing gyms.
